page.title: 06Barnby in the W. Farming 2
page.content: One of the occupations in the village is pig farming. This usually only employs people from the farmer's own family. Pig farming has had a somewhat precarious existence in recent years. One of the problems confronting the industry is that of producing a pig which meets with market demands, at present calling for a lean animal rather than the fat pig of some years ago. The current trend is the result of the move against eating animal fat on health grounds. Another problem is the price of the pig set against the price of the feed. The arable farmer wants a high price for his cereals but the pig farmer wants a low price for his feed, these two are difficult to reconcile. The present price is 102pence/kg. for fat pigs and Â£138/tonne for the feed.
